key_points: Oprah Winfrey's interview with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle is highly anticipated in the US, marking their shift from British royalty to potential Hollywood elite.
The interview will be the couple's first since stepping back from their royal duties in early 2020.
Concerns have been raised in the UK over the timing of the interview, with Prince Philip hospitalized, while US commentators focus on a potential 'smear' campaign by the palace.
The Sussexes have been active in the US, discussing issues like racism, police brutality, and voting rights, and have secured deals with Netflix and Spotify.
The couple's move and statements have been credited with changing the royal family and continuing to challenge the monarchy.
Winfrey's interview is expected to cover the racism Meghan faced in the UK, their treatment by the British press, and their motivation for moving to the US.
Experts suggest the interview is an opportunity for Harry and Meghan to address misconceptions and criticisms, particularly the term 'Megxit'.
Oprah Winfrey, who has become close to the couple in the US, is seen as a guiding figure in their transition to life outside royal duties.
A poll found Queen Elizabeth II remains the favorite royal among Americans, but Harry and Meghan are also popular.
The formal separation of Harry and Meghan from royal duties allows for a possible re-invention of their public image.
